content:
Organizing your Studies and Advice Informatics - TUM - TUM School of Computation, Information and Technology



----------------------------------------

Organizing your Studies and Advice
Organizing your Studies and Advice

Informatics Study Programs
Organizing your Studies and Advice > Informatics Study Programs
Organizing your Studies and Advice
----------------------------------------

Academic Advising
Academic Advising
Studying at TUM Informatics is demanding and challenging. If you are facing a problem or a challenge, we are here to support you! You can contact the academic advisors in order to discuss your prospects and find a solution together. Our consultation hour pages can be found here: Katharina Rieke, Vivija Čeprkalo-Simić, Dr. Sandra Kemler, Imme Proske.
You should also take a look at our Tips for Successful Studies.
Academic Advising
----------------------------------------

Barrier-Free Education
Barrier-Free Education
We want to make it possible for everyone to study and participate in student life equally and independently. Do you have questions or need support? If yes, contact the Informatics Representative for Students with Chronic Illnesses or Disabilities: Imme Proske.
Barrier-Free Education
----------------------------------------

International Student Advising
International Student Advising
Financial questions, registration of your new address, residence permit, insurances, learning or improving German - those who want to study in Germany have a lot to get sorted out. For all non-academic questions, international degree students can contact our international student advisor Lena Krone.
International Student Advising
----------------------------------------

Studying Abroad
Studying Abroad
Developing intercultural competence, learning languages on site, discovering foreign cultures, making contacts and broadening your own horizons: everyone benefits in many ways from a stay abroad.
Studying Abroad
----------------------------------------

Your Contacts for Examination Matters
Your Contacts for Examination Matters

Who is in charge of what matter?
Your Contacts for Examination Matters > Who is in charge of what matter?

- Registration, submission and grade entry of student research projects and theses
Registration, submission and grade entry of student research projects and theses
